summary: Produces a flexible and robust ground truth set for base calling training

arguments.summary: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
arguments.name: --add-output-sam-program-record

arguments.summary: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.
arguments.name: --add-output-vcf-command-line

arguments.summary: base path for ancestral translation ancestral.contig.csv files
arguments.name: --ancestral-translators-base-path

arguments.summary: Sequence to append (adapter)
arguments.name: --append-sequence

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Base qualities below this threshold will be reduced to the minimum (6)
arguments.name: --base-quality-score-threshold
arguments.fulltext: Bases with a quality below this threshold will reduced to the minimum usable qualiy score (6).

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.
arguments.name: --cloud-index-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).
arguments.name: --cloud-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: If true, create a BAM/CRAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM/CRAM file.
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a MD5 digest for any BAM/SAM/CRAM file created
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-md5

arguments.summary: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a a MD5 digest any VCF file created.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-md5

arguments.summary: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified.  Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.
arguments.name: --disable-bam-index-caching

arguments.summary: If false this disables capping of base qualities in the HMM to the mapping quality of the read
arguments.name: --disable-cap-base-qualities-to-map-quality

arguments.summary: Read filters to be disabled before analysis
arguments.name: --disable-read-filter

arguments.summary: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!
arguments.name: --disable-sequence-dictionary-validation

arguments.summary: Toggle to revive legacy behavior of asymmetrically normalizing the arguments to the reference haplotype
arguments.name: --disable-symmetric-hmm-normalizing

arguments.summary: Disable all tool default read filters (WARNING: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on)
arguments.name: --disable-tool-default-read-filters

arguments.summary: Discard reads which are softclipped, unless the softclip is polyT, defaults to true
arguments.name: --discard-non-polyt-softclipped-reads

arguments.summary: disable DRAGstr pair-hmm score even when dragstr-params-path was provided
arguments.name: --dont-use-dragstr-pair-hmm-scores

arguments.summary: het to hom prior ratio use with DRAGstr on
arguments.name: --dragstr-het-hom-ratio

arguments.summary: location of the DRAGstr model parameters for STR error correction used in the Pair HMM. When provided, it overrides other PCR error correcting mechanisms
arguments.name: --dragstr-params-path

arguments.summary: Will enable less strict read disqualification low base quality reads
arguments.name: --enable-dynamic-read-disqualification-for-genotyping
arguments.fulltext:
If enabled, rather than disqualifying all reads over a threshold of minimum hmm scores we will instead choose a less strict
 and less aggressive cap for disqualification based on the read length and base qualities.

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing
arguments.name: --exclude-intervals
arguments.fulltext:
Use this argument to exclude certain parts of the genome from the analysis (like -L, but the opposite).
 This argument can be specified multiple times. You can use samtools-style intervals either explicitly on the
 command line (e.g. -XL 1 or -XL 1:100-200) or by loading in a file containing a list of intervals
 (e.g. -XL myFile.intervals).

arguments.summary: Error rate used to set expectation for post HMM read disqualification based on mismatches
arguments.name: --expected-mismatch-rate-for-read-disqualification

arguments.summary: skip haplotype bases until same base as read starts (false SNP compensation)
arguments.name: --false-snp-compensation

arguments.summary: Softclipped reads should be filled from haplotype, otherwise (default) filled with -83
arguments.name: --fill-softclipped-reads

arguments.summary: Reads with tm:Q or tm:Z should be filled from haplotype, otherwise (default) filled with -80
arguments.name: --fill-trimmed-reads

arguments.summary: Reads with tm:Q should be filled from haplotype, otherwise (default) filled with -80
arguments.name: --fill-trimmed-reads-Q

arguments.summary: Reads with tm:Z should be filled from haplotype, otherwise (default) filled with -80
arguments.name: --fill-trimmed-reads-Z

arguments.summary: Cap probabilities of error to 1 relative to base call
arguments.name: --flow-disallow-probs-larger-than-call

arguments.summary: Value to fill the zeros of the matrix with
arguments.name: --flow-fill-empty-bins-value

arguments.summary: Should all probabilities of insertion or deletion in the flow be combined together
arguments.name: --flow-lump-probs

arguments.summary: Modifications instructions to the read flow matrix. Format is src,dst{,src,dst}+. Example: 10,12,11,12 - these instructions will copy element 10 into 11 and 12
arguments.name: --flow-matrix-mods

arguments.summary: probability scaling factor for (phred=10) for probability quantization
arguments.name: --flow-probability-scaling-factor

arguments.summary: Lowest probability ratio to be used as an option
arguments.name: --flow-probability-threshold

arguments.summary: Number of bins for probability quantization
arguments.name: --flow-quantization-bins

arguments.summary: Should the probabilities of more then 1 indel be used
arguments.name: --flow-remove-non-single-base-pair-indels

arguments.summary: Remove probabilities of basecall of zero from non-zero genome
arguments.name: --flow-remove-one-zero-probs

arguments.summary: Report either insertion or deletion, probability, not both
arguments.name: --flow-report-insertion-or-deletion

arguments.summary: Keep only hmer/2 probabilities (like in base format)
arguments.name: --flow-retain-max-n-probs-base-format

arguments.summary: Should indel probabilities be symmetric in flow
arguments.name: --flow-symmetric-indel-probs

arguments.summary: Use t0 tag if exists in the read to create flow matrix
arguments.name: --flow-use-t0-tag

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: do not generate output records
arguments.name: --gt-no-output

arguments.summary: Number of N to append to best haplotype on output
arguments.name: --haplotype-output-padding-size

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Include supplementary alignments
arguments.name: --include-supp-align

arguments.summary: BAM/SAM/CRAM file containing reads
arguments.name: --input

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are excluding.
arguments.name: --interval-exclusion-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -XL. For example, '-XL 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-XL 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals
arguments.name: --interval-merging-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program merges abutting intervals (i.e. intervals that are directly side-by-side but do not
 actually overlap) into a single continuous interval. However you can change this behavior if you want them to be
 treated as separate intervals instead.

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are including.
arguments.name: --interval-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -L. For example, '-L 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-L 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs
arguments.name: --interval-set-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program will take the UNION of all intervals specified using -L and/or -XL. However, you can
 change this setting for -L, for example if you want to take the INTERSECTION of the sets instead. E.g. to
 perform the analysis only on chromosome 1 exomes, you could specify -L exomes.intervals -L 1 --interval-set-rule
 INTERSECTION. However, it is not possible to modify the merging approach for intervals passed using -XL (they will
 always be merged using UNION).

 Note that if you specify both -L and -XL, the -XL interval set will be subtracted from the -L interval set.

options.summary: Take the union of all intervals
options.name: UNION

options.summary: Take the intersection of intervals (the subset that overlaps all intervals specified)
options.name: INTERSECTION

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate
arguments.name: --intervals

arguments.summary: prevent spreading of boundary flows.
arguments.name: --keep-boundary-flows

arguments.summary: Lenient processing of VCF files
arguments.name: --lenient

arguments.summary: What likelihood calculation engine to use to calculate the relative likelihood of reads vs haplotypes
arguments.name: --likelihood-calculation-engine

options.summary: Classic full pair-hmm all haplotypes vs all reads.
options.name: PairHMM

arguments.summary: maternal reference file
arguments.name: --maternal-ref

arguments.summary: maximal number of reads to output
arguments.name: --max-output-reads

arguments.summary: Maximal read quality
arguments.name: --max-rq

arguments.summary: If non-zero, partitions VCF output into shards, each containing up to the given number of records.
arguments.name: --max-variants-per-shard

arguments.summary: Minimal score (likelihood) on either haplotype
arguments.name: --min-haplotype-score

arguments.summary: Minimal score (likelihood) delta between haplotypes
arguments.name: --min-haplotype-score-delta

arguments.summary: Minimal mapping quality
arguments.name: --min-mq

arguments.summary: How many threads should a native pairHMM implementation use
arguments.name: --native-pair-hmm-threads

arguments.summary: use double precision in the native pairHmm. This is slower but matches the java implementation better
arguments.name: --native-pair-hmm-use-double-precision

arguments.summary: main CSV output file. the file containing maternal/parental maternal and paternal haplotype sequences and scores (and many more columns). supported file extensions: .csv, .csv.gz.
arguments.name: --output-csv

arguments.summary: Required length of output flows
arguments.name: --output-flow-length

arguments.summary: Flat gap continuation penalty for use in the Pair HMM
arguments.name: --pair-hmm-gap-continuation-penalty

arguments.summary: The PairHMM implementation to use for genotype likelihood calculations
arguments.name: --pair-hmm-implementation
arguments.fulltext: The PairHMM implementation to use for genotype likelihood calculations. The various implementations balance a tradeoff of accuracy and runtime.

arguments.summary: File to write exact pairHMM inputs/outputs to for debugging purposes
arguments.name: --pair-hmm-results-file
arguments.fulltext: Argument for generating a file of all of the inputs and outputs for the pair hmm

arguments.summary: paternal reference file
arguments.name: --paternal-ref

arguments.summary: The PCR indel model to use
arguments.name: --pcr-indel-model
arguments.fulltext: When calculating the likelihood of variants, we can try to correct for PCR errors that cause indel artifacts. The correction is based on the reference context, and acts specifically around repetitive sequences that tend to cause PCR errors). The variant likelihoods are penalized in increasing scale as the context around a putative indel is more repetitive (e.g. long homopolymer). The correction can be disabling by specifying '-pcrModel NONE'; in that case the default base insertion/deletion qualities will be used (or taken from the read if generated through the BaseRecalibrator). VERY IMPORTANT: when using PCR-free sequencing data we definitely recommend setting this argument to NONE.

options.summary: no specialized PCR error model will be applied; if base insertion/deletion qualities are present they will be used
options.name: NONE

options.summary: a most aggressive model will be applied that sacrifices true positives in order to remove more false positives
options.name: HOSTILE

options.summary: a more aggressive model will be applied that sacrifices true positives in order to remove more false positives
options.name: AGGRESSIVE

options.summary: a less aggressive model will be applied that tries to maintain a high true positive rate at the expense of allowing more false positives
options.name: CONSERVATIVE

arguments.summary: The global assumed mismapping rate for reads
arguments.name: --phred-scaled-global-read-mismapping-rate
arguments.fulltext:
The phredScaledGlobalReadMismappingRate reflects the average global mismapping rate of all reads, regardless of their
 mapping quality.  This term effects the probability that a read originated from the reference haplotype, regardless of
 its edit distance from the reference, in that the read could have originated from the reference haplotype but
 from another location in the genome.  Suppose a read has many mismatches from the reference, say like 5, but
 has a very high mapping quality of 60.  Without this parameter, the read would contribute 5 * Q30 evidence
 in favor of its 5 mismatch haplotype compared to reference, potentially enough to make a call off that single
 read for all of these events.  With this parameter set to Q30, though, the maximum evidence against any haplotype
 that this (and any) read could contribute is Q30.

 Set this term to any negative number to turn off the global mapping rate.

arguments.summary: Sequence to prepend (barcode)
arguments.name: --prepend-sequence

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Read filters to be applied before analysis
arguments.name: --read-filter

arguments.summary: Indices to use for the read inputs. If specified, an index must be provided for every read input and in the same order as the read inputs. If this argument is not specified, the path to the index for each input will be inferred automatically.
arguments.name: --read-index

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program.  The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --read-validation-stringency

arguments.summary: Reference sequence
arguments.name: --reference

arguments.summary: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse
arguments.name: --seconds-between-progress-updates

arguments.summary: Use the given sequence dictionary as the master/canonical sequence dictionary.  Must be a .dict file.
arguments.name: --sequence-dictionary

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.
arguments.name: --sites-only-vcf-output

arguments.summary: subsampling ratio, should be between 0 and 1
arguments.name: --subsampling-ratio

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
An internal tool to produce a flexible and robust ground truth set for base calling training.

Input

  • Coordinate-sorted and indexed SAM/BAM/CRAM
  • Maternal and Parental references (fa)
  • Folder with address translation files from reference to maternal/parental references (filename example: maternal.chr9.csv)

Output

  • CSV file containing maternal/parental haplotype scores and many more columns (.csv or .csv.gz supported)
At present, the output will contain the following columns (not nessarily in this order) for each processed read:
  • ReadName, ReadChrom, ReadStart, ReadEnd, tm, mapq, flags, ReadCigar, ReadSequence, ReadUnclippedStart, ReadUnclippedEnd - information directly extracted from the input read
  • PaternalHaplotypeInterval, BestHaplotypeSequence, PaternalHaplotypeScore - parental haplotype information. First the read interval is translated into parental space, the haplotype sequence extracted and then scored
  • Maternal* - same for maternal
  • RefHaplotypeScore - score computed from the reference haplotype
  • BestHaplotypeKey - flow based key for the 'best' (score wise) haplotype (out of the maternal/paternal) pair)
  • ConsensusHaplotypeKey - a flow based key constructed from the flow keys of the maternal and paternal haplotypes, containing only keys that agree (other keys filled with fixed/special value)

Usage examples

 gatk GroundTruthReadsBuilder \
  -R
  ../../../ref/Homo_sapiens_assembly38.fasta
  -I
  150548-UGAv3-4.chr9.cram
  --maternal-ref
  chr9_HG001_maternal.fa
  --paternal-ref
  chr9_HG001_paternal.fa
  --ancestral-translators-base-path
  ./
  --output-csv
  output-small.csv
  --subsampling-ratio
  1.0
  --max-output-reads
  100000000
  --intervals
  chr9:109991494-109991494
  --smith-waterman
  FASTEST_AVAILABLE
  --likelihood-calculation-engine
  FlowBased
  -mbq
  0
  --kmer-size
  10
  --gt-debug
  --output-flow-length
  1000
  --haplotype-output-padding-size
  8
  --prepend-sequence
  TTTT
  --append-sequence
  CCCC
name: GroundTruthReadsBuilder
